intro: Wintera colorata, commonly known as the golden wintera, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value comes from its striking color contrast between dark green leaves and vibrant yellow blooms. Wintera colorata is often cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal and hardy nature.
